tool_description:
Multilingual sentiment analysis of texts from different sources (blogs, social networks,...).
Besides polarity at sentence and global level, Sentiment Analysis uses advanced natural language processing techniques to also detect the polarity associated to both entities and concepts in the text. Sentiment Analysis also gives the user the possibility of detecting the polarity of user-defined entities and concepts, making the service a flexible tool applicable to any kind of scenario. Additionally, Sentiment Analysis detects if the text processed is subjective or objective and if it contains irony marks [beta], both at global and sentence level, giving the user additional information about the reliability of the polarity obtained from the sentiment analysis.
name: Sentiment Analysis
title: Sentiment Analysis

api_list.name: sentiment-2.1

required_parameters.name: lang
required_parameters.description: Language in which to analyze the text

required_parameters.name: txt
required_parameters.default: In the country of Sokovia, the Avengers – Tony Stark, Steve Rogers, Thor, Bruce Banner, Natasha Romanoff, and Clint Barton – raid a Hydra outpost led by Wolfgang von Strucker, who has been experimenting on humans using the scepter previously wielded by Loki. They encounter two of Strucker's experiments – twins Pietro, who has superhuman speed, and Wanda Maximoff, who can manipulate minds and project energy – and apprehend Strucker, while Stark retrieves Loki's scepter.

required_parameters.name: model
required_parameters.description: Sentiment model to use in the analysis

optional_parameters.name: dm
optional_parameters.description: Type of disambiguation applied. It is accumulative, that is, the semantic disambiguation mode will also include morphosyntactic disambiguation. Possible values: n (no disambiguation), m (morphosyntactic disambiguation), s (semantic disambiguation)

optional_parameters.name: sdg
optional_parameters.description: Semantic disambiguation grouping. This parameter will only apply when semantic disambiguation is activated (dm=s). Possible values: n (none), g (global intersection), t (intersection by type), l (intersection by type - smallest location)

optional_parameters.name: cont
optional_parameters.description: Disambiguation context. Context prioritization for entity semantic disambiguation

optional_parameters.name: uw
optional_parameters.description: Deal with unknown words. This feature adds a stage to the topic extraction in which the engine, much like a spellchecker, tries to find a suitable analysis to the unknown words resulted from the initial analysis assignment. It is specially useful to decrease the impact typos have in text analyses. Possible values: y or n

optional_parameters.name: rt
optional_parameters.description: This parameter indicates how reliable the text to analyze is (as far as spelling, typography, etc. are concerned), and influences how strict the engine will be when it comes to take these factors into account in the analysis. Possible values: y, n or u (enabled just for user dictionary)

optional_parameters.name: egp
optional_parameters.description: Expand global polarity. This mode allows you to choose between two different algorithms for the polarity detection of entities and concepts. Enabling the parameter gives less weight to the syntactic relationships, so it's recommended for short texts with unreliable typography. Possible values: y or n
